Title: AI / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Are you a passionate AI/ML Engineer looking to make a significant impact in a dynamic and innovative environment? Join our team and be at the forefront of AI-driven transformation!

About The Team

Data is the fuel that keeps our world moving, and we at Natuvion are experts in moving large quantities of it. We are a small team of computer science experts dedicated to accelerating data transformation, making it more efficient, pleasant, and secure. Essentially, we operate as a startup within a well-established company. Our team members hold advanced degrees in computer engineering, logic, physics, and related fields, fostering a culture of deep technical expertise and continuous learning. We pride ourselves on our fast-paced development, strong team culture, and open, focused communication.

Why Join Us?


Innovative Projects: Work on designing and implementing fascinating projects like implementing a programming language in conjunction with cutting-edge AI applications.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a team that values open communication and collaboration, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Engage with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply them to real-world problems.
Professional Growth: Benefit from a culture that encourages continuous learning and professional development.



Your Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms to solve complex problems and enhance our products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Conduct data preprocessing and feature engineering to prepare data for modeling.
Implement and optimize AI techniques such as semantic search, NLP, and recommendation systems.
Ensure code quality and scalability through the use of typing tools like mypy and pyright.
Generate comprehensive documentation and presentations to communicate findings and solutions.
Analyze current AI scenarios, identify gaps, and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning to continuously improve our solutions.



Job requirements

Core Skills


Deep Learning and Machine Learning: Proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Understanding of current models and their applications.
AI Techniques and Applications: Experience with various AI techniques such as semantic search, natural language processing (NLP), and recommendation systems.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a strong emphasis on scalable and understandable code using typing tools like mypy and pyright. Familiarity with Haskell is a plus.
Data Preprocessing and Feature Engineering: Expertise in preparing and transforming raw data into suitable formats for modeling.
Documentation and Presentation: Ability to generate comprehensive documentation and presentations.
Collaboration and Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively within the team and with other stakeholders.
Analyzing AI Scenarios: Ability to analyze the current basis for specific AI scenarios like Automatic Data Analysis, Root Cause Identification, Mapping Rule Generation, and other relevant areas for large scale data transformations. Identify gaps and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.



About Our Core Products


DCS (Data Conversion Server): An orchestration engine for designing, executing, and monitoring data transformation workflows within SAP systems.
Compose: A programming language for DCS that enables bidirectional compilation, allowing DCS content to be converted into Compose code and vice versa, facilitating version control, continuous integration, and more.



What You Can Expect From Us

An environment that is always open to change and optimization. There is no such thing as ‚Äúthat's the way it's always been‚Äù with us. You have the chance to contribute your knowledge, shape processes, standardize existing topics or optimize workflows. Be a driving force and take us even further with your expertise!

We Create An Environment In Which You Feel Comfortable


Home office contracts
Permanent employment and 30 days' vacation
Trust-based working hours - work in a way that best suits your everyday life and our customers
Mentoring program - a good induction according to your needs for an optimal start with us
#teamgreen - An internal network of experienced experts for mutual exchange and the joint development of solutions to problems
An appreciative employee culture, flat hierarchies, short communication channels and an open-door policy - a team that supports and inspires each other!
Regular team events and workshops on site
With our new health benefit 'Nilo' you get 10 free therapy sessions a year and can use the app for meditations, lessons and courses - all for your well-being!
Further training is a priority



Join #teamgreen - Natuvion is a digital moving company.

Our team doesn't move desks, filing cabinets or chairs. Natuvion moves business-critical data and processes from one technology platform to another. Typical Natuvion ‚Äúrelocation services‚Äù include data migration, data transformation, data integration, data protection, data security and data quality.

Our >400 consultants and developers in Germany, Austria, Slovakia, the USA and Australia have extensive expertise in (SAP¬Æ) projects and a profound understanding of processes across industry boundaries. With a great deal of experience, commitment and dedication, they support our customers with consulting, services and our own software technology. In this way, we enable companies to use their data and processes on the most modern and innovative platforms at all times.

Join us and be a part of a team that is at the forefront of AI innovation, driving transformation and delivering value to our clients and partners. If you are passionate about AI and eager to make an impact, we would love to hear from you

Title: Salesforce Developer
Description:
Salesforce Developer ‚Äì Commerce Focus

Berlin

Hybrid (3 days onsite)







Are you an experienced Salesforce Developer with a passion for e-commerce and expertise in Salesforce Order Management System (OMS)? Join a leading force in the gaming and tech industry, where we create cutting-edge online shopping experiences.




The Role

As a Salesforce Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimizing Salesforce Commerce Cloud and OMS solutions. Your work will directly impact online store performance, order management processes, and customer experience.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Salesforce Commerce Cloud Development ‚Äì Build and maintain scalable e-commerce solutions.

Title: Research Sciences Intern (VISION)
Description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential‚Äîand excitement for the journey ahead.

The Applied Sciences Group (ASG) is seeking a highly motivated and talented PhD student to join our team as a Research Intern. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge research in the fields of Large Language Models (LLMs), Vision-Language Models (VLMs), and Generative Image & Video. The successful candidate will collaborate with a team of experienced researchers and engineers to tackle real-world challenges and contribute to the advancement of AI technologies.

Responsibilities


Conduct research in one or more of the following areas: LLMs, VLMs, and Generative Image & Video.
Design and implement experiments to test new hypotheses and validate research findings.
Develop and optimise algorithms and models for various AI applications.
Collaborate with team members to integrate research outcomes into practical solutions.
Present research findings to the team and contribute to publications and patents.


Qualifications

Required: Qualifications:


Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Strong background in LLMs, VLMs, or Generative Image & Video.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication skills and the ability to present complex ideas clearly.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong track record of success, evidenced by publications in prestigious computer vision and machine learning conferences, including NeurIPS, ECCV, ICCV, CVPR.
Proven software engineering capabilities, evidenced by professional experience, internships, impactful open-source contributions, and success in coding competitions.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Position as Data Scientist (m/f/d) ‚Äì Pilot Project Lignin Chemistry
Company: Max Planck Institute of Colloids and Interfaces
Description:
Online since 2025-03-12

Position as Data Scientist (m/f/d) ‚Äì Pilot Project Lignin Chemistry

Deadline

31.03.2025

Start of work

as soon as possible

Working time model

Full time

About Us

The Center for the Transformation of Chemistry (CTC) aims to reimagine the chemical industry as sustainable and resilient. Divided into 5 interconnected thematic areas; Automation & Standardization, Data-driven Chemistry, Recycling, Renewable Feedstocks, and Societal-Environmental-Economic Metrics (SEEM); the CTC has identified strong pillars to guide its scientific efforts towards the transformation of chemistry.

The CTC Science Team is currently planning multiple pilot projects and looking for ambitious people taking the lead.

We are seeking a highly motivated data scientist to lead the development of a comprehensive database of lignin-derived compounds. As a Data Scientist (m/f/d) ‚Äì Pilot Project Lignin Chemistry, you will leverage machine learning and large language models to automate data extraction, curation, and prediction of lignin-derived compounds. This role offers a unique opportunity to conduct pioneering research at the intersection of computational science, data management, and sustainable chemistry. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with an interdisciplinary team of chemists, data scientists, and engineers to accelerate lignin valorization and drive innovation in the biorefinery sector.

As part of CTC‚Äôs Science team, you‚Äôll be located in Leuna in the greater Leipzig/Halle area.

Your Tasks And Qualifications


Harness large language models to extract and synthesize lignin-related information from scientific literature (e.g., reaction conditions, yields, and catalysts).
Develop and apply machine learning models for data curation, predictive analytics, and structure-property relationship modeling.
Design and implement an open-access database cataloging lignin-derived compounds, including chemical properties, reaction pathways, and potential applications.
Independently analyze scientific results, troubleshoot computational approaches, and design innovative workflows.
Interact iteratively with the CTC‚Äôs scientists to define the users‚Äô requirements and develop tailored solutions according to the peculiar features of the generated data.
Present research findings at conferences and publish in scientific journals.


Your profile


Successfully completed degree (at least a Master‚Äôs, ideally PhD) in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Data Science, Computational Chemistry, or a related field.
Strong experience in programming languages such as Python.
Proven experience in machine learning (e.g., random forests, neural networks, and gradient boosting) and natural language processing.
Experience with cheminformatics tools (e.g., RDKit, PubChem) and database management systems (e.g., SQL, NoSQL).
Knowledge of computational tools for reaction network visualization (e.g., Cytoscape, Gephi).
Hands-on experience in biomass valorization is a plus.
Willingness to learn new tools and technologies as required.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and leadership skills to engage with internal and external stakeholders.


What we offer


The opportunity to perform your research at what will be the largest research center for chemical research in Europe.
Benefit from a large network: Meet and work with top experts from academia and industry.
Competitive compensation according to TV√∂D-Bund up to E13 depending on the candidate‚Äôs qualifications.
Partial compensation of Job Commute Ticket.
Comprehensive social benefits, including 30 days of vacation per year, annual special payment, and additional pension scheme (VBL).
Term-limited position until the 31st of December, 2025 allowing for fresh perspectives in terms of contract extension after 2025.


The Max Planck Society strives for gender equality and diversity. We welcome applications from all backgrounds. The Max-Planck Society is committed to increasing the number of individuals with disabilities in its workforce and therefore encourages applications from such qualified individuals. Furthermore, the Max Planck Society seeks to increase the number of women in those areas where they are underrepresented and therefore explicitly encourages women to apply.

The position is available starting immediately after the offer is awarded.

To apply for the position of Data Scientist (m/f/d) at the CTC in, please submit your CV and a concise overview of relevant experience via our online application management tool.

Learn more about the CTC and our mission at:

https://transforming-chemistry.org/en/landingpage/

Join us in shaping the future of chemistry and making a lasting impact!

Title: Software Solutions Engineer / Data Scientist
Description:
Join truemetrics - Build technology to navigate the world

truemetrics helps organizations to navigate the world more efficiently. We are solving one of the biggest pain points in last mile delivery: how to get parcels, groceries, and food to the right door faster and more efficiently.

Our technology sits in the smartphone of the courier and understands where they park and enter a building. Our technology is right now mapping locations in Kasachstan, Qatar, Germany, Switzerland, the UK and many other countries.

Who we are

We are a tech-driven, customer-obsessed company with a small but highly skilled team, pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in mapping and positioning.

We thrive on autonomy, ownership, and speed‚Äîwhich means we‚Äôre looking for curious problem-solvers who love tackling hard challenges and making an immediate impact. If you want structure, rigid processes, and a slow corporate environment, this is not the place for you.

Why join us?


Real Impact: Solve practical challenges that help thousands of delivery drivers navigate cities more efficiently.
Collaborative Environment: Work closely with a tight-knit team of founders and engineers scaling the company.
Technical Depth: Tackle advanced problems in positioning, sensor fusion, and large-scale data processing.
Industry Shaping: Influence the future of AI-driven mapping technology in a rapidly growing sector.
Global Ambition: Join a startup partnering with top logistics companies like GLS, DPD, and Snoonu.
Dynamic Culture: Experience the fast-paced environment of a Silicon Valley-connected startup. We are backed by some of the most successful investors in the world like Y-Combinator, Soma Capital or Rebel Fund.


Why NOT to join us?

If you‚Äôre looking for a big team, a slow-paced environment, or a job where you can coast along without ownership, this probably isn‚Äôt the right fit. We move fast, iterate quickly, and expect everyone to contribute with initiative and creativity.

Requirements


You are based in Berlin or willing to relocate within four weeks of starting.
You thrive in a dynamic startup environment, where fast development cycles and quick deployment are essential.
You have 4+ years of experience in software engineering, data analysis, or software engineering management.
You meet most of the following criteria:
Strong Python skills: You have at least 3-5 years of hands-on coding experience.
Data Visualization & Data Science: You enjoy making complex data understandable and have a solid background in Data Science or Mathematics, especially in working with geospatial data.
Cloud Expertise: You are familiar with AWS architecture and comfortable working with serverless tools (e.g., AWS Lambda, Athena, S3).
Customer-Focused Mindset: You enjoy working closely with customers, helping them get the most out of the product, and explaining technical concepts in an accessible way.
Allrounder: You are fine with switching between roles. Sometimes you are a project manager, sometimes a Data Scientist, sometimes a Backend engineer or QA engineer.

Your Role at Truemetrics

Data Exploration, Analysis & Improvement


Analyze and prepare data: By preparing data in a way that is easy to understand, you ensure our customers receive meaningful insights.
Customer Success & Onboarding: You help present our product to customers and continuously improve the early onboarding experience.
Support POCs & Pilot Projects: You help manage proof-of-concept (POC) and pilot projects, ensuring smooth execution and learning opportunities.


Software Engineering


Troubleshooting & Data Quality: If something breaks in our data, you investigate the root cause and propose solutions. If everything burns, you are playing the detective to find out what didn‚Äôt went well
Prototyping & Innovation: You design and implement early prototypes for new features and contribute ideas for improving our algorithms and data processing techniques.


How to Apply


Include the role's title in your subject line.
Please include your CV .
Please tell us why you think you would be a good fit for this role, be specific.
Do you have an impressive GitHub repo to prove your skills? Great!
Show more

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
Interested in leading data-driven innovation while working in a collaborative, high-impact environment? Passionate about machine learning, big data, and predictive modeling?




We‚Äôve partnered with a fast-growing tech company that is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to drive data strategy, machine learning implementation, and data product development across the org. This role offers the opportunity to work on large-scale data solutions, mentor a growing team, and establish best practices in data science and analytics.




What You‚Äôll Be Working On:

Driving data science and analytics strategy, fostering collaboration and best practices
Implementing machine learning models for predictive analytics and product enhancements
Improving existing data analysis and reporting structures
Designing and optimizing data pipelines with tools like Apache Airflow, DAGster, and DBT
Working with large datasets to enhance product performance and decision-making
Establishing best practices for cost-effective, scalable data solutions
Mentoring and guiding data analysts and scientists within the organization




Ideal Experience:

Proven industry experience in big data, data warehousing, and data products
Strong background in LLMs, NLP, and predictive modeling
Hands-on experience with SQL, Python, Spark, DuckDB, Snowflake, and Metabase
Expertise in building scalable data pipelines and working with large datasets
Knowledge of servant leadership principles in autonomous product team environments




Other Important Details:

Hybrid role based in Berlin
Competitive salary and benefits package
30 vacation days & remote work flexibility (up to 3 months per year!)
Company pension, wellness programs, and professional development opportunities




This is an opportunity to lead and shape the future of data science within a forward-thinking company. If you're interested or want to know more, click Apply or reach out to Ionut Roghina for more details.

Title: Junior AI Solutions Engineer
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a Junior ML Scientist who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Partnering directly with the Head of AI, your focus will be on developing AI Applications. In this role, you will combine your appreciation for Technology with your capacity for creative AI Solutions. You will develop skills crucial to advancing in a competitive, fast-paced retail sector, all within a company that prizes dedication and results.

What You Will Do


Craft Next-Level AI Solutions



Design, build, and optimise advanced LLM pipelines, emphasizing prompt engineering and chain-of-thought methodologies.

Actively research, prototype, and integrate new techniques to enhance LLM performance across real-world use cases.


Automate Business Processes



Develop automated workflows and AI agents using n8n.io (or similar platforms like Make), streamlining and optimizing key business processes.

Efficiently automate routine tasks, creating practical and reliable solutions that save time and resources.


AI Applications



Move swiftly from prototypes to tangible AI products, ensuring your work has immediate, measurable impact on business operations and customer experiences.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to manage AI project lifecycles from concept to deployment, demonstrating strong project management skills.

What You Should Bring


Python & ML Framework Proficiency



Excellent programming skills in Python.

Hands-on experience with popular machine learning frameworks, especially LangChain or LlamaIndex.


AI-Assisted Coding



Practical experience with AI-enhanced IDEs‚Äîparticularly Cursor.

A commitment to innovative coding practices (‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù) and continuous improvement of your development workflow.


Automation & Workflow Expertise ( n8n.io )



Hands-on experience building automation workflows using n8n.io (or Make/Copilot Studio).

Ability to enhance productivity and drive process improvements through well-designed automation solutions.


Database & API Skills



Solid experience working with standard databases (Redis, SQL/NoSQL).

Proficiency in retrieving, cleaning, transforming, and managing data via APIs for analytics and AI-driven applications.


Continuous Learner & Active Consumer of AI Content



You stay on top of the rapidly evolving AI landscape by actively consuming and engaging with content on platforms like X (Twitter), YouTube, and industry blogs.

Eagerness to translate new findings into actionable, real-world improvements.


Passion for AI‚Äôs Business Impact



A genuine excitement for the potential of AI to transform business processes.

Ability to quickly turn cutting-edge ideas into tangible, impactful solutions for internal operations and customer-facing products.

What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days‚Äô holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
Access to customised training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a Junior ML Scientist who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Partnering directly with the Head of AI, your focus will be on developing AI Applications. In this role, you will combine your appreciation for Technology with your capacity for creative AI Solutions. You will develop skills crucial to advancing in a competitive, fast-paced retail sector, all within a company that prizes dedication and results.

What You Will Do

  • Craft Next-Level AI Solutions


Design, build, and optimise advanced LLM pipelines, emphasizing prompt engineering and chain-of-thought methodologies.

Actively research, prototype, and integrate new techniques to enhance LLM performance across real-world use cases.

  • Automate Business Processes


Develop automated workflows and AI agents using n8n.io (or similar platforms like Make), streamlining and optimizing key business processes.

Efficiently automate routine tasks, creating practical and reliable solutions that save time and resources.

  • AI Applications


Move swiftly from prototypes to tangible AI products, ensuring your work has immediate, measurable impact on business operations and customer experiences.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to manage AI project lifecycles from concept to deployment, demonstrating strong project management skills.

What You Should Bring

  • Python & ML Framework Proficiency


Excellent programming skills in Python.

Hands-on experience with popular machine learning frameworks, especially LangChain or LlamaIndex.

  • AI-Assisted Coding


Practical experience with AI-enhanced IDEs‚Äîparticularly Cursor.

A commitment to innovative coding practices (‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù) and continuous improvement of your development workflow.

  • Automation & Workflow Expertise ( n8n.io )


Hands-on experience building automation workflows using n8n.io (or Make/Copilot Studio).

Ability to enhance productivity and drive process improvements through well-designed automation solutions.

  • Database & API Skills


Solid experience working with standard databases (Redis, SQL/NoSQL).

Proficiency in retrieving, cleaning, transforming, and managing data via APIs for analytics and AI-driven applications.

  • Continuous Learner & Active Consumer of AI Content


You stay on top of the rapidly evolving AI landscape by actively consuming and engaging with content on platforms like X (Twitter), YouTube, and industry blogs.

Eagerness to translate new findings into actionable, real-world improvements.

  • Passion for AI‚Äôs Business Impact


A genuine excitement for the potential of AI to transform business processes.

Ability to quickly turn cutting-edge ideas into tangible, impactful solutions for internal operations and customer-facing products.

What We Can Offer You

  • A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
  • Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
  • Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days‚Äô holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
  • Access to customised training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
  • Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.


Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: DevOps/ML Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Machine Learning Reply, we work with our customers on cutting-edge projects for which we are looking for DevOps and ML Engineers to support our customer projects around machine learning and data processing across various industries. To expand our team, we are looking for a talented and highly skilled consultant with a technical background to join our team. As a consultant, you will be responsible for providing expert advice and technical support to our clients.

If you're a DevOps or ML Engineer or just starting out in the field of machine learning and/or DevOps engineering - if you never lose focus, love coding, data and AI, and are passionate about bringing your ideas to life - then we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:


Design innovative, technical approaches for data intensive and applications with a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Implement and take ownership for your solutions on in either cloud based (AWS, Azure or GCP) and/or on-premises infrastructures of our customers.
Automate recurring tasks by state-of-the-art DevOps and MLOps concepts, enabling your customers to significantly reduce their time-to-delivery.
Take care of the necessary‚ÄØmonitoring, failover, and recovery infrastructures‚ÄØthat allow our customers save operation of their machine learning solutions in agreement with latest regulatory requirements
Closely‚ÄØinteract with customers and stakeholders‚ÄØto translate concrete and complex business requirements into production-ready‚ÄØsolutions
Collaborate with various disciplines‚ÄØsuch as enterprise architects, analysts,‚ÄØdata scientists or‚ÄØdata engineers‚ÄØto develop data-intensive applications such as data warehouses, data lakes and/or data platforms



What we offer you:


Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)
Broaden your skills through interdisciplinary work and training in the areas of data engineering, cloud architecture, and data science
Benefit from industry-leading cooperations in the cloud, BI, and AutoML field
Very active social program - including training, conferences, team buildings, Reply Exchange, communities of practices, and hackathons
Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge-sharing network
Award-winning office space in downtown Munich with access to ‚ÄúStammstrecke‚Äù
You choose your state-of-the-art equipment
Public transport ticket with Deutschlandticket
Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice
Flexible work environment between client, Reply office, and remote work



Minimum Job Requirements / Qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs / master‚Äôs degree in computer science or any other related fileds (e.g. engineering, statistics, physics).
First practical experience with DevOps/MLOps principals and computing platforms like Microsoft Azure, AWS and GCP as well as Databricks.
Ability to convincingly communicate and present analytical results to management.
We cover the full lifecycle of Data, from Cloud Infrastructure, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, and Visualization to ML Engineering to and MLOps. Interest and/or experience in some of those fields is an advantage.
Fluent in English and able to speak German at least at a B2 Level.



Desired:


Working experience in cloud technologies (AWS, Azure or GCP), Kubernetes and programming languages like Python, Java and Scala.
Practical experience with SQL and NoSQL database technologies and data lakes
Experience with big data technologies (Apache Spark), data streaming (Apache Kafka) and workflow orchestration (Apache Airflow, Dagster)
Show more

Title: Associate Research Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for an Associate Research Scientist to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients‚Äô real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

In this role, you will work as a member of the Research Sciences (RS) department, primarily supporting our work in the UK, Germany, and Japan. This team provides customized real-world data and real-world evidence solutions to address the most important research questions across clinical development, market access, and commercial use cases for our life sciences partners.

In this role, you will:



Develop subject matter expertise in real-world oncology data to support data product development and evidence generation.
Design and conduct in-depth analyses to assess data quality and fitness-for-use for real-world evidence generation in the international markets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including epidemiologists, data scientists, and oncologists, to refine methodologies and ensure rigorous study execution.
Implement statistical analyses by translating analytic specifications from a statistical analysis plan into R code to generate descriptive and inferential statistics and develop visualizations.
Contribute to external scientific publications, including manuscripts and conference abstracts, to advance the field of oncology real-world evidence.
Stay current with epidemiological and statistical methodologies for analyzing observational real-world data and deepen expertise in cancer biology, therapies, and outcomes across multiple tumor types.



Who You Are

You're a kind, passionate and collaborative problem-solver who values the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition, you‚Äôre an analytical thinker and excellent communicator with experience or interest in supporting design and execution of real-world studies that support use cases across the oncology product development life cycle. You are excited by the prospect of rolling up your sleeves to tackle meaningful problems each and every day. Additionally:



You hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Health Economics and Outcomes Research, Health Policy (or closely related field) with 2 - 3 years of relevant professional experience, or a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in one of those fields with 4-5 years of relevant professional experience
You have experience working in a pharmaceutical, HEOR consulting, healthcare analytics, or academic research environment
You have experience with observational datasets (e.g., registries, healthcare claims, or electronic health records)
You‚Äôre proficient at coding in R
You have strong communication skills, with experience contributing to study documentation
You have effective organizational, time-management, and prioritization and skills necessary to contribute to multiple high-visibility projects in a timely fashion
You have an agile mindset and adapt quickly to changes in project direction
You are able to quickly learn and apply new information, skills and procedures
You are passionate about our mission to improve healthcare through technology



Optional



You have oncology experience
You are fluent in German



Who We Are

Our people are at the centre of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity.
Show more

Title: Full-stack Developer (w/m/d)
Description:
About Us

At Media4Care, we‚Äôre not your typical fast-paced tech company. Instead, we pride ourselves on thoughtful, secure growth and deep innovation in the Senior Care-Tech space. Our mission? To enhance the lives of seniors and individuals with dementia, creating a positive impact not just for them, but also for their families and caretakers. With our state-of-the-art digital assistance system, we‚Äôre bringing a touch of joy and ease into their daily routines, one thoughtful innovation at a time.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

As part of our compact yet mighty team, you‚Äôll be pivotal in shaping the future of senior care technology:


Craft and Innovate: Design and develop new features for our app suite that make a real difference.
Collaborate and Elevate: Share your expertise in code reviews, uplifting the quality of work through collaborative wisdom.
Quality First: Commit to delivering the best possible experience for our users, ensuring reliability and smooth operation.
Grow with Us: Embrace opportunities for personal and professional growth within a supportive team environment.
Enhance User Experience: Focus on creating intuitive, user-friendly interfaces that delight both our customers and your fellow team


MOTIVATION


Meaningful Work: Your contributions directly enhance the quality of life for seniors, offering you a role with social impact and personal fulfillment.
Steady Growth: We‚Äôre committed to growing wisely, focusing on secure and sustainable development. Here, you‚Äôre more than a cog in the machine; you‚Äôre a key part of our journey.
Continuous Learning: Benefit from internal training sessions, Tech Talks, and hackathons, all designed to keep you at the forefront of technology.
Work-Life Harmony: Enjoy working in one of Berlin‚Äôs most picturesque locations, with a team culture that values balance and well-being.


Requirements


Solid Foundation: A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (or equivalent) and at least 5+ years of relevant experience, with expertise in TypeScript, PostgreSQL, and GraphQL on the backend, plus familiarity with React Native for frontend work.
Backend Proficiency: Strong experience with PostgreSQL database design/optimization and GraphQL API development. You should be comfortable taking ownership of backend architecture and implementation.
Full Stack Versatility: While your primary focus will be backend development, you must be willing and able to contribute to the React Native frontend as needed in our collaborative team environment.
Team Synergy: You thrive in a team setting, contributing to a collaborative and positive working environment where responsibilities may shift based on project needs.
Problem-Solving Mindset: You're driven to find solutions and improve processes across the entire stack, always looking for the best way forward.
Bonus Skills: Experience with AWS, Docker, CI/CD pipelines, and performance optimization for both database queries and API endpoints. Experience with PostGraphile, TypeORM, Prisma, or similar GraphQL/ORM tools is a plus.


About Us

Media4Care is an innovative and fast-growing Senior Care-Tech company. Our products are an expression of our deep wish to improve the joy of life of seniors and people with dementia. Not just for the affected persons, but for all relatives and their caretakers. In order to make this vision come true, we have developed a digital assistance system for seniors.

Today, we are already supporting more than 4,000 care homes and private homes in Germany. Our system was specifically developed to offer seniors an entertaining cognitive training and help them to stay easily connected with their families.

Our shared vision is greatly supported by strong industry partners and investors.

Title: Data Scientist - Consumer (Global Discovery)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist to join the Search & Ranking team within consumer discovery on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.


Develop and Optimize Search Algorithms: Enhance and research new search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization, to deliver the most relevant results to our users.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work as part of a cross-functional team, including Backend Engineers, Product Managers, and Data Engineers, to improve our global search end-2-end.
Analyze and interpret large datasets: Extract meaningful insights to understand relevance problems.
Innovate and Experiment: Identify and apply the best machine learning and statistical methods to solve complex problems, ensuring solutions are scalable and effective in production environments.
Navigate Ambiguity: Define and tackle data science problems amidst ambiguity, ensuring clear problem definitions and actionable insights


At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

What you need to be successful


Experience: Master‚Äôs degree (or Bachelor‚Äôs with 4+ years of work experience) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Theoretical Chemistry, or similar. 2+ years of experience as a data scientist working on applying data science fundamentals to solve complex business problems
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in SQL and Python and its ML ecosystem is essential. Experience with Java and Scala is a plus.
Machine Learning Knowledge: Strong understanding of a wide variety of ML and statistical methods, including Classical ML, Deep Learning, NLP, and Recommendation Systems. Ability to discern the most suitable approach for different problems.
Search and Ranking ML Algorithms: Hands-on experience with search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization.
Problem-Solving: Comfortable with ambiguity and capable of navigating it to define clear data science problems and solutions. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering practical solutions.
Collaborative Spirit: Proven experience working in cross-functional teams, contributing effectively to joint projects and achieving common goals. Excellent communication skills to articulate complex ideas and influence stakeholders.


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world‚Äôs leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We‚Äôre also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Free lunch 2 days per week
Pension plan contributions
Public transportation subsidies
Bike leasing program
Monthly social events, massages, Thursday happy hours, sports teams
An awesome office in Friedrichshain, Berlin


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer

Location: Berlin/Hybrid




We are seeking a talented and driven AI Engineer to join fast-growing AI start-up, REMATIQ. This is an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI solutions that are transforming regulatory affairs. As a AI Engineer, you will take ownership of designing, building, and scaling machine learning systems that drive impactful innovation in the industry.




Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy machine learning models into production.
Build and optimize scalable and efficient machine learning pipelines for data processing, model training, and deployment.
Lead efforts in identifying, implementing, and validating the best algorithms and techniques for solving business challenges.
Take ownership of model performance, monitoring, and continuous improvement in production.
Mentor junior team members and contribute to fostering a collaborative engineering culture.
Research and stay up-to-date on advancements in machine learning, MLOps, and related technologies.
Contribute to the development of best practices in model lifecycle management, including reproducibility and version control.




Requirements

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or AI Engineer in a similar role, with expertise in Python.
Strong track record of delivering production-grade machine learning systems, including model deployment and monitoring.
Proficiency in at least one of the following areas:
Data Science: Advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and insights generation.
MLOps: Building robust CI/CD pipelines for machine learning workflows and automation.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Fine-tuning, training, or deploying state-of-the-art transformer-based models.
Natural Language Processing (NLP): Developing applications like text classification, summarization, or entity recognition.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with scalable data storage and processing systems (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, or similar).
Passion for leveraging AI to revolutionize regulatory affairs.




Nice-to-Have Skills

Experience working in an early-stage start-up
Familiarity with regulatory affairs or compliance-related applications.
Contributions to open-source machine learning projects.
Expertise in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong software engineering practices, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.




Why Join Us?

Innovative Mission: Be part of transforming regulatory affairs with cutting-edge AI technology.
Impactful Role: Take ownership of significant projects and contribute to shaping the future of the industry.
Collaborative Environment: Work with a small, ambitious team where everyone has real ownership over the product and company.
Growth Opportunities: Learn and grow in a fast-paced start-up environment with continuous professional development.
Compensation: Competitive salary and a generous equity package for early employees..




Join REMATIQ and be a driving force in revolutionizing regulatory affairs through AI. If you are a passionate and skilled AI Engineer ready to make an impact, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages cutting-edge technology to develop Machine Learning solutions that optimize our platforms and processes. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

Job Description


Translate business needs into data science questions and take ownership of the research and development of Machine Learning solutions that bring positive business impact
Partner with engineering and product teams to deploy Data Science services and embed them in the Auto1 tech infrastructure
Monitor model performance in production, share results with stakeholders and develop actionable next steps
Identify business opportunities and collaborate with stakeholders and partners in tech to drive growth
Set priorities and support junior members to achieve project goals


Qualifications


At least 2 years of hands-on experience working with deep learning/neural networks. Experience with recommender system and pytorch would be considered an advantage
Proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience in AWS/Azure/Google Cloud would be considered an advantage.
Proficiency in the full lifecycle of data science projects, including initializing/designing, developing (building the model), and deploying models in production (full stack)
Advanced statistical and quantitative knowledge with commercial experience, preferably with academic experience in a quantitative research field
Demonstrated strong stakeholder interaction and visualization skills to effectively present findings in a clear and unambiguous way


Additional Information


Working from home: you can work from home up to 5 days a week
International teams
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development
Personal growth with the contribution of own ideas
Exciting team events like Hackathons to foster collaboration and innovation
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars


Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Data Scientist (Global Ranking)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist to join our GlobalRanking and Recommendations domain and help us enhance our user experience and with that help our customers easily discover new products and vendors. If you‚Äôre a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.


Deep dive into our data to generate insights about our customers, our products and our existing recommendation techniques.
Develop new data products from conception to production to help optimize our recommendation systems and improve the experience for our customers.
Transform fuzzy/high-level requirements and objectives to solvable problem statements and requirements
Collaborate with Senior Data Scientists, Product Specialists, and user experience squads to understand business processes, identify data and solution requirements.
Work with Data Engineers / MLOps to optimize and deploy your models.
Scale up your algorithm to provide business value in dozens of countries globally supporting multiple brands and millions of customers.
Help defining data needs to further improve existing algorithms.
Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources (BigQuery, PostgreSQL etc and many more).
Contribute and make an impact in a global, fast-moving tech organization.


What you need to be successful


You have at least 3 years of experience applying methods from Machine Learning and Statistics to real-world datasets.
You excel at modeling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver value to the business.
You can write maintainable code that follows best practices in Software Engineering and effectively software versioning with Git.
You are eager to put your models to production to get real customer feedback as soon as possible.
You have the ability to understand a business problem and translate, structure it into a data science problem.
Fluency in Python and familiarity with its scientific stack such as numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, matplotlib.
You have previous experience building recommendation or ranking systems.
You have experience with experimentation with different approaches through an AB testing methodology and offline evaluation
You know how to write a SQL query to pull the data you need.
Fluency in English.


Nice to have:


You have experience solving problems related to offline evaluation and monitoring recommendation & ranking systems.
Experience deploying complex models to serve live traffic and collaborating with ML engineers in creating efficient systems that integrate ML models following good MLOps practices.
Practical experience and knowledge of Deep Learning models & NLP techniques.
You know how to make your code run in a container and are enthusiastic about running it in modern infrastructure environments like Kubernetes.
Knowledge of GCP and cloud in general.


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more
HTML:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist to join our GlobalRanking and Recommendations domain and help us enhance our user experience and with that help our customers easily discover new products and vendors. If you‚Äôre a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

  • Deep dive into our data to generate insights about our customers, our products and our existing recommendation techniques.
  • Develop new data products from conception to production to help optimize our recommendation systems and improve the experience for our customers.
  • Transform fuzzy/high-level requirements and objectives to solvable problem statements and requirements
  • Collaborate with Senior Data Scientists, Product Specialists, and user experience squads to understand business processes, identify data and solution requirements.
  • Work with Data Engineers / MLOps to optimize and deploy your models.
  • Scale up your algorithm to provide business value in dozens of countries globally supporting multiple brands and millions of customers.
  • Help defining data needs to further improve existing algorithms.
  • Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources (BigQuery, PostgreSQL etc and many more).
  • Contribute and make an impact in a global, fast-moving tech organization.

What you need to be successful

  • You have at least 3 years of experience applying methods from Machine Learning and Statistics to real-world datasets.
  • You excel at modeling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver value to the business.
  • You can write maintainable code that follows best practices in Software Engineering and effectively software versioning with Git.
  • You are eager to put your models to production to get real customer feedback as soon as possible.
  • You have the ability to understand a business problem and translate, structure it into a data science problem.
  • Fluency in Python and familiarity with its scientific stack such as numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, matplotlib.
  • You have previous experience building recommendation or ranking systems.
  • You have experience with experimentation with different approaches through an AB testing methodology and offline evaluation
  • You know how to write a SQL query to pull the data you need.
  • Fluency in English.

Nice to have:

  • You have experience solving problems related to offline evaluation and monitoring recommendation & ranking systems.
  • Experience deploying complex models to serve live traffic and collaborating with ML engineers in creating efficient systems that integrate ML models following good MLOps practices.
  • Practical experience and knowledge of Deep Learning models & NLP techniques.
  • You know how to make your code run in a container and are enthusiastic about running it in modern infrastructure environments like Kubernetes.
  • Knowledge of GCP and cloud in general.

Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - AI Agents & Generative AI (f/m/d)*
Description:
Your Mission

As a Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)*, you will evaluate and improve the performance of our AI Agents. This will involve developing evaluation tasks for agent behaviour, fine-tuning foundation models, researching and prototyping new AI Agent features and frameworks, and investigating issues affecting our customers. You‚Äôll develop a deep understanding of the behaviour of our models and AI Agents. You‚Äôll work directly with product engineering and sales teams, leading by example on evaluating and improving our product - from testing new AI system optimisation frameworks to fine-tuning STT models on new languages and accents.

You‚Äôll join the AI & Data Science Team, a collaborative group of Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists that own Parloa‚Äôs ML Evaluation Platform and the machine learning models that power our product. The team is responsible for keeping Parloa at the forefront of research and development of Generative AI and AI Agent based products.

In This Role You Will


Take ownership of data science and machine learning projects that help us improve our generative AI product suite
Develop and evaluate production Agentic AI systems for real customer use cases
Directly support and collaborate with product engineering and sales, analyzing the performance of our AI products and prototyping new features
Evaluate and train or fine-tune a variety of models, including LLMs, intent classification, STT, and TTS models
Execute Machine Learning research and development projects end-to-end, rapidly turning new ideas into customer facing features


Our Tech stack (AI & Data): Python, OpenAI, LangGraph, SQL, Microsoft Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Eventhubs (Kafka), PostHog, Databricks, DeltaLiveTables, Preset

What You Bring To The Table


7+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
Experience developing and owning production ML models and systems. Experience with LLMs, NLP, or information retrieval is a strong plus
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with using using Python in production
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark) and using ML Ops platforms (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience with owning the ML process end-to-end: from gathering requirements to experimentation to productionisation, monitoring and optimization.
Experience in leading medium-sized technical projects (3-9 months roadmap)
Strong spoken and written communication skills in English


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?


Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +40 nationalities with flat hierarchies and a collaborative company culture
Flexible office policy - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office
Attractive compensation package
Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth
Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities
Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass or Urban Sport Club.
We cover the cost of a monthly Deutschland train ticket.
Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities
And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks
Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity


Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call ‚Üí Hiring Manager Interview ‚Üí Technical Stage 1 (Data Science Coding Session) ‚Üí Technical Stage 2 (Machine Learning Theory & Case Study) ‚Üí Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa‚Äôs voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that‚Äôs revolutionizing an entire industry. We‚Äôre passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we‚Äôre expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Parloa is committed to upholding the highest data protection standards for our clients' and employees' data. All our employees are instrumental in ensuring the utmost care, GDPR, and ISO compliance, including ISO 27001, in handling sensitive information.


We provide equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national origin, disability status, socioeconomic background and other characteristics.
