Title: Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That‚Äôs where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Data Scientist (d/f/m) at Aignostics, you work on interdisciplinary projects to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. Together with your colleagues you apply state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to solve complex real-world problems. You independently conduct rigorous experiments while also contributing well-designed features to our codebase.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ data scientists, software developers, biologists, and pathologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take responsibility and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


Work on interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
Apply and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images
Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
Clearly communicate your results


What We Are Looking For


Degree in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
Eagerness to learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
Solid theoretical foundations and 1-2 years of experience developing novel machine learning techniques
Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
Experience with development of deep learning models for computer vision
Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
Excellent communication and team working skills


Bonus points for


Exposure to biomedical data
Experience in considering Information Security criteria under ISO 27001


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

About Us

aignostics.com

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Description

We at sevdesk:

As an intuitive cloud accounting software, we empower founders, self-employed individuals, and small business owners to focus on what truly matters. Our product offers them a smart accounting tool to save time in their daily activities. As a company, we aim for excellence, continuously expand our horizons, and strive for daily improvement of our product and our daily work life. In pursuit of these goals, we rely on our strong culture, innovative spirit, and unwavering passion. In the future, we hope to count you among our dedicated team members.

Your Mission:

As a Data Scientist in our Data Team, you simplify accounting processes for our customers by designing and implementing practical machine learning solutions that address real-world problems and deliver significant value for our users and our company. You collaborate with Product and ML engineering to seamlessly integrate your models into production systems.

Here's how you'll make an impact:


You ensure scalability, reliability and maintainability of ML solutions by following best practices.
You combine and clean data, perform complex analyses, and apply modern ML and deep learning algorithms to identify data patterns.
You develop a proof-of-concepts with product teams and business units to demonstrate the added value of your solutions.
You translate domain-specific problems into mathematical and technical requirements and explain complex relationships simply.
You enjoy to mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.


Your Qualification:


You hold a degree in mathematics, a technical field or a related discipline, with 3-5 years of relevant professional experience as a Data Scientist.
You have profound knowledge in machine learning/deep learning, statistical analysis and in developing business cases for data science products.
You are proficient in SQL/NoSQL, Python and common ML libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, PyTorch).
You understand typical challenges in developing and providing Data Science products and the pros and cons of various ML/DL algorithms.
You are confident with software development best practices, container technologies (such as Docker) and cloud platforms.
You write clean, modular, and testable code, moving beyond Jupyter notebooks to production-quality solutions.


Our Tech Stack

AWS | Python | Dagster | Terraform | Dbt | Snowflake | Github | Containers | Traditional ML & GenAI models


Experience with these tools is a plus, but we value your ability to design and implement systems with similar tools and discuss design trade-offs in each product category, possibly suggesting improvements to our stack.


Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you‚Äôre most productive, whether that‚Äôs at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, ‚Ä¶), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!





For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Marc Riehle

Title: Sports Scientist (m/f/x)
Description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and passionate individual who is committed to enhancing performance and wellbeing of our clients though data driven guidance. HAGIUS is pleased to offer an exceptional opportunity for a Sport Scientist (m/f/x) to join our dedicated team. With our small team, we provide a unique environment where every contribution is valued, yet our scale is sufficient to have a meaningful impact within the Wellness and Fitness industry.




The ideal candidate will possess a strong desire to assist our clients in achieving their fitness and wellness objectives. If you excel in a dynamic, supportive atmosphere and are keen on collaborating with a team equally committed to health and wellbeing, we invite you to apply.


Tasks



Working in and as part of a team of experts


Conducting personal training sessions and classes


Creating and performing physical assessments (using tools like force plates)


Assessing mental and emotional wellbeing


Analyzing assessment data and setting goals with clients


Creating training plans, schedules, recommendations based on data


Guiding clients through their journey at Hagius


Observing the progress made by clients


Gathering feedback from clients and trainers.


Fine-tune plans depending on progress and assessment data


Ensuring flow of information to the necessary team members



Requirements



Interest in the tasks above


Passion for data-driven fitness guidance


Ability to work as a team player in a team of experts


High-quality education in sports science (University Degree or comparable education)


at least one year work experience in the field of data driven training



Benefits



being part of a passionate team that's striving for honest training with high quality


free participation in classes and usage of facilities





We are looking forward to your application.

Show more

Title: AI Engineer (m/f/d) in B2B SaaS AI Startup
Description:
We are traide AI ü§ñ, a groundbreaking deep tech, VC-backed, B2B startup powered by AI ( we did AI long before the hype üòâüòÅ) .




Our breakthrough in revenue, with an increase of over 10x in the past year, positions us at the brink of a significant expansion phaseüî•. By developing the definitive "global trade compliance intelligence platform", building up around our customs classification engine, fully powered by (artifical-) Intelligence, we‚Äôre already transforming the landscape of international trade.




Our product, team, and vision have convinced already prestigious partners like PwC, and our customer base includes industry juggernauts such as Siemens, every day industry Heros like W√ºrth, alongside other notable figures in industry. We are rapidly solidifying our leadership position within the EU while eyeing global expansion üèÜ.




AI is deeply embedded in the DNA of our company, reflected in the extensive AI expertise of our founders, the culture within our company and team, and our proven track record of developing and commercializing AI while delivering real business value with AI-centered features ü§ñ üß¨ . This role aims to strengthen our AI DNA, enabling us to further execute our vision and missionüöÄ .




If you are an exceptional individual and feel that you would be a great fit for our compact yet highly skilled team, let us know about you. We would be delighted to hear from you ü§ùüí° !


Tasks


As an AI Engineer, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with our product and tech team to develop innovative features that address customer needs and drive business impact. In this role, you'll engage in:





Research & Experimentation: Research and delve into cutting-edge AI techniques, prototype novel ideas, and rigorously validate concepts through experiments and metrics.


End-to-End Development: Transform research insights into production-ready features through careful planning, prototype development, quality assurance, and seamless integration of AI functionalities.


Problem Solving & Innovation: With a curious and analytical mindset, you‚Äôll ask the deeper ‚Äúwhy‚Äù questions to uncover root problems, explore creative solutions, and bring them to life.


Take a product-focused approach and care about building solutions that are robust, scalable, and easy to use.





While you‚Äôll take on significant responsibility, you‚Äôre never alone. You can rely on a supportive team where knowledge-sharing and mutual growth are core values.


Requirements



Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in: Data-Sience, Machine learning, Deeplearning and/or Generative AI & AI-Agents. With a proven track record of developing and deploying AI-driven solutions in production environments.


Strong Software-Engineering OR Data-Science background. Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or comparable experience.


Strong analytical, logical reasoning, skills with a creative approach to problem-solving.


Willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.


Communication skills, collaborative attitude and ability to work effectively within a diverse team.





Experience with some of these technologies:
- Programming Language: Python (required); Deeplearning Frameworks: pytorch, tensorflow, Other: ML-Ops


Benefits


So, why choose traide AI?




On the product side





Meetings and processes kept to a minimum and focus on getting things done (Kanban Style).


We value clean and well-tested code and ship features only once they are up to standard


Modern tech stack with the opportunity to shape future decisions: React + Chakra-UI, Node.js + GraphQL, Python + Pytorch, LLM/Generative AI and more





In the organization




‚úîÔ∏è traide AI is a place where you can be your authentic self!




‚úîÔ∏è We are creators, not rule followers. In our open culture, ideas take precedence over hierarchies, truth finding is essential üôå




‚úîÔ∏è Our work culture is flexible and grounded entirely in trust and integrity, where everyone strives to grow & learn




‚úîÔ∏è And the cherry on top? Our offices are the coolest around ‚Äì our cozy Berlin office is conveniently located at Rosenthaler Platz and offers fantastic lunch spots.




We look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you better üöÄ




If you have any questions, just email us.

Title: (Senior) Machine Learning Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
We are Kineo, a Berlin-based tech startup developing machine learning solutions that bring real, tangible business value to our clients. Through our expertise, mindset, culture and most importantly with your help we are turning the AI landscape upside down. Are you excited to contribute to meaningful, impactful projects?




Our proposition to you





We vouch to create a space where you can explore different sets of complex problems and data across industries and verticals.


To support you in your personal development, everyone at Kineo has a mentor. When you grow, so does Kineo.


Your decisions matter! You will not have a boss who decides things for you. At Kineo we believe that decisions are best made locally, by the people closest to the problem at hand.


Transparent salary and career planning from day one.


A beautiful office in the centre of Kreuzberg, with tons of benefits, such as free drinks, snacks, consoles etc.


28 days of vacation


A shared revenue model - when Kineo does well, you will benefit financially, too





Success in the role means that you will have





After 2 months: You established yourself as a member of the team and have already contributed to one of our client projects. You have a clear understanding of how we work and can independently navigate our technical architecture.


After 6 months: You are a key member of the team and fully involved in the development of a client project. You will have made notable contributions to our codebase and internal processes.


After 12-24 months: In collaboration with internal science and engineering resources, you lead the development of a client-facing application from the workshop phase to production. You are a trusted expert in a wide variety of machine learning algorithms and you are able to transfer that knowledge to more junior members of the team.





Your Character Traits





You want to achieve something and don't need a "manager" to tell you that. You are eager to have space to take responsibility and grow from that.


You enjoy exploring beyond your immediate tasks and are open to learning new skills. You collaborate across different areas to help the team succeed, even in areas outside your main expertise.


You are a strong communicator with the ability to present ideas clearly and collaborate effectively. You value building positive relationships and working together to achieve shared goals.





You fit in with our team culture if you





Enjoy working in an environment that combines pragmatic, commercial thinking with a strong desire to learn and grow together. We value team players that are curious but convey humility and respect for different opinions.


You actively choose to work in a start-up, with all the ups and downs.


See open feedback, accountability and independent thinking as the foundation for exceptional (team) work.


You embrace Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. You are excited to contribute to an environment where different perspectives are celebrated, and you actively participate in fostering awareness and continuous learning around DEI.



Tasks



You will work as part of smaller teams of 2-3 people on developing machine learning solutions with our clients.


You will conceptualize and implement algorithmic solutions to challenging business problems. This includes prototyping and productionizing of machine learning solutions, and also defining and analysing product use cases together with the customer.


You will own machine learning solutions from the first drop of raw data, all the way into production serving millions of inference requests.



Requirements



An advanced quantitative degree - e.g Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related fields. Strong knowledge of theoretical math and CS.


At least two years of work experience as Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer.


Knowledge of working with large structured and unstructured data sets. Knowledge of data engineering tools like Apache Spark is an advantage.


Strong programming skills in Python. We love other languages too, but Python is what we (and you) will use.


We are AI Consultants - ask yourself: Do you want to be a Consultant?


Experience in using a wide range of ML frameworks such as SKLearn, Tensorflow, Torch in production. Experience with domain specific libraries like OpenCV, HuggingFace etc are an advantage.


Good written and verbal communication in both English and German. Most of our clients are German speaking so a level of at least B2 is required for the role.


Resident in Germany. Due to the size of the company, we cannot currently accept applications from other EU/non-EU countries.





We explicitly do not hire anyone who discriminates against people on the basis of religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status or other aspects. We encourage people from LGBTQIA+ and other underrepresented groups to apply.




Last but not least, keep in mind that we are hiring value based, not skill based. That being said, please tell us the following in your contact message:





Why we would love to work with you


Why you want to work with us
Show more

  • Why we would love to work with you

  • Why you want to work with us

Title: Data Scientist - Marketing Technology
Description:
Location: Berlin, in-office

SumUp enables merchants around the world to get paid easily, process orders quickly, sell online instantly and manage their money more efficiently. We create tools that help merchants to build a thriving business.

The cross-functional MarTech team is collaboratively responsible for improving our customer acquisition. This includes optimizing our worldwide online marketing spendings, attributing new customers to marketing campaigns, automating content creation through AI, calculating the customer lifetime value of our merchants, and using data from various sources for analysis and decision making. Based on that data, we develop machine-learning models that help us achieve the above mentioned goals.

For that, we are looking for a passionate Data Scientist to complement our team. We will innovate, drive impact for our customers and SumUp, and have fun together.

What you‚Äôll do:


Work closely with stakeholders to build valuable solutions and enable them to use these efficiently.
Analyse data to build and operate machine-learning models that predict user behaviour, optimise marketing spendings, or create marketing content using generative AI.
Work on predictions and insights that contribute to shaping the direction of the company.
Be part of an international team spanning two continents and consisting of a Product Manager, Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and Data Engineers.


You‚Äôll be great for this role if:


You have a degree in statistics, mathematics, economy, computer science or comparable
You have 2+ years of experience in data science
You bring experience in building, delivering, and continuously iterating machine learning models and algorithms end-to-end at scale
You possess experience in experimenting and measuring experiments (setting up a/b tests, lift tests or geo tests) and evaluating them
You have experience using Python with its scientific stack (e.g. pandas, sklearn, numpy, statsmodels, xgboost, matplotlib, seaborn) and knowledge of SQL
You bring great communication and data visualization skills and the ability to effectively convey complex insights to non-technical stakeholders, enhancing collaboration and informed decision-making
You embrace best practices for clean, maintainable and testable code


Why you should join SumUp


We‚Äôre a truly global team of 3200+ people from 80+ countries, spread across 4 continents
We are open to location based out of Berlin or Copenhagen
We offer visa and relocation support for you, your family and even your pets
A dedicated annual Learning & Development budget for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education
Enrolment onto our virtual stock ownership program - you will own a stake in SumUp‚Äôs future success
The opportunity to work on large scale fintech products used by millions of businesses around the world
Corporate pension scheme
Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches and other location-tailored benefits


About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder‚Äôs mentality and a 'team-first‚Äô attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Research Sciences Intern (VISION)
Description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential‚Äîand excitement for the journey ahead.

The Applied Sciences Group (ASG) is seeking a highly motivated and talented PhD student to join our team as a Research Intern. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge research in the fields of Large Language Models (LLMs), Vision-Language Models (VLMs), and Generative Image & Video. The successful candidate will collaborate with a team of experienced researchers and engineers to tackle real-world challenges and contribute to the advancement of AI technologies.

Responsibilities


Conduct research in one or more of the following areas: LLMs, VLMs, and Generative Image & Video.
Design and implement experiments to test new hypotheses and validate research findings.
Develop and optimise algorithms and models for various AI applications.
Collaborate with team members to integrate research outcomes into practical solutions.
Present research findings to the team and contribute to publications and patents.


Qualifications

Required: Qualifications:


Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Strong background in LLMs, VLMs, or Generative Image & Video.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication skills and the ability to present complex ideas clearly.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong track record of success, evidenced by publications in prestigious computer vision and machine learning conferences, including NeurIPS, ECCV, ICCV, CVPR.
Proven software engineering capabilities, evidenced by professional experience, internships, impactful open-source contributions, and success in coding competitions.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
Interested in leading data-driven innovation while working in a collaborative, high-impact environment? Passionate about machine learning, big data, and predictive modeling?




We‚Äôve partnered with a fast-growing tech company that is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to drive data strategy, machine learning implementation, and data product development across the org. This role offers the opportunity to work on large-scale data solutions, mentor a growing team, and establish best practices in data science and analytics.




What You‚Äôll Be Working On:

Driving data science and analytics strategy, fostering collaboration and best practices
Implementing machine learning models for predictive analytics and product enhancements
Improving existing data analysis and reporting structures
Designing and optimizing data pipelines with tools like Apache Airflow, DAGster, and DBT
Working with large datasets to enhance product performance and decision-making
Establishing best practices for cost-effective, scalable data solutions
Mentoring and guiding data analysts and scientists within the organization




Ideal Experience:

Proven industry experience in big data, data warehousing, and data products
Strong background in LLMs, NLP, and predictive modeling
Hands-on experience with SQL, Python, Spark, DuckDB, Snowflake, and Metabase
Expertise in building scalable data pipelines and working with large datasets
Knowledge of servant leadership principles in autonomous product team environments




Other Important Details:

Hybrid role based in Berlin
Competitive salary and benefits package
30 vacation days & remote work flexibility (up to 3 months per year!)
Company pension, wellness programs, and professional development opportunities




This is an opportunity to lead and shape the future of data science within a forward-thinking company. If you're interested or want to know more, click Apply or reach out to Ionut Roghina for more details.

Title: Internship AI Engineer
Description:
Summary of the role

Flinn‚Äôs AI team is seeking a motivated and talented STEM student (undergraduate or graduate level) to join our AI research team as an intern. In this role, you will collaborate with seasoned data scientists, software engineers, and researchers to develop and optimize AI models and related tools. You‚Äôll have hands-on exposure to the full lifecycle of our AI projects and direct involvement in creating transformative solutions. This role offers a lot of remote work flexibility, while we appreciate regular in-person interactions at our offices in Vienna, Berlin, or Paris.




Why Flinn:

We are building a truly exceptional culture: While many companies claim to have a great culture, we invite you to discover what truly sets ours apart. Visit our career page, speak with our team, listen to our founders‚Äô podcast, or experience our culture first-hand during the interview process.
Make a Meaningful Impact: Your work at Flinn contributes directly to solutions that improve people‚Äôs health and lives by making high-quality health products accessible for everyone.
Experienced, well-funded, highly professional: As well-funded startup veterans, we know how to sustain long-term business health and success, ensuring an environment for continuous personal growth.




Your contributions to our journey:

1) Programming & Prototyping

Write efficient, well-documented Python code for data preprocessing, model training, and evaluation.
Create proof-of-concept demos and pilot programs to validate research ideas.

2) AI Model Development

Assist in the design and implementation of machine learning models.
Contribute to model debugging, hyperparameter tuning, and performance evaluations.

3) Research Support

Perform literature reviews and research on state-of-the-art AI techniques and frameworks.
Summarize findings to guide the direction of ongoing projects.

4) Data Collection & Processing

Source and prepare data from internal and external datasets.
Clean, transform, and label datasets for training AI and machine learning models.

5) Collaboration & Reporting

Work closely with cross-functional teams including data scientists, product managers, and software engineers.
Present project updates, results, and next-step recommendations in regular team meetings




What you need to be successful:

1) Education & Background

Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a STEM field (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or related discipline).

2) Technical Skills

Proficiency in Python with demonstrated experience in data manipulation libraries (e.g., NumPy, Pandas).
Understanding of version control tools (Git).

3) Analytical & Research Skills

Strong problem-solving abilities and interest in emerging AI and machine learning methods.
Exposure to data analytics, statistical methods, or scientific research is a plus.

4) Communication & Teamwork

Ability to communicate complex technical concepts effectively.
Willingness to ask questions, learn new tools, and collaborate in a dynamic team environment.




At this stage of our company, we can only accept applications from people who are based in Europe with either European citizenship, an active working visa or being self-employed and joining us as a full-time contractor.




What is in for you?

Hands-On Experience¬†in developing real-world AI solutions and research prototypes.
Mentorship¬†from experienced professionals in AI, software engineering, and data science.
Collaborative Culture¬†with regular knowledge-sharing sessions and workshops.
Flexible Schedule¬†that can adapt to your academic commitments.
Potential for Future Opportunities¬†including full-time roles upon successful internship completion.
Compensation: 10-15 Euros per hour.




üí° Do you want to learn more about us? Have a look at our Career Page: https://career.flinn.ai




We strive to remove barriers, eliminate discrimination, and ensure equal opportunity through our transparent recruitment process. We are open to all groups of people without regard to age, color, national origin, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status or any other legally protected characteristic.

Title: Software Solutions Engineer / Data Scientist
Description:
Join truemetrics - Build technology to navigate the world

truemetrics helps organizations to navigate the world more efficiently. We are solving one of the biggest pain points in last mile delivery: how to get parcels, groceries, and food to the right door faster and more efficiently.

Our technology sits in the smartphone of the courier and understands where they park and enter a building. Our technology is right now mapping locations in Kasachstan, Qatar, Germany, Switzerland, the UK and many other countries.

Who we are

We are a tech-driven, customer-obsessed company with a small but highly skilled team, pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in mapping and positioning.

We thrive on autonomy, ownership, and speed‚Äîwhich means we‚Äôre looking for curious problem-solvers who love tackling hard challenges and making an immediate impact. If you want structure, rigid processes, and a slow corporate environment, this is not the place for you.

Why join us?


Real Impact: Solve practical challenges that help thousands of delivery drivers navigate cities more efficiently.
Collaborative Environment: Work closely with a tight-knit team of founders and engineers scaling the company.
Technical Depth: Tackle advanced problems in positioning, sensor fusion, and large-scale data processing.
Industry Shaping: Influence the future of AI-driven mapping technology in a rapidly growing sector.
Global Ambition: Join a startup partnering with top logistics companies like GLS, DPD, and Snoonu.
Dynamic Culture: Experience the fast-paced environment of a Silicon Valley-connected startup. We are backed by some of the most successful investors in the world like Y-Combinator, Soma Capital or Rebel Fund.


Why NOT to join us?

If you‚Äôre looking for a big team, a slow-paced environment, or a job where you can coast along without ownership, this probably isn‚Äôt the right fit. We move fast, iterate quickly, and expect everyone to contribute with initiative and creativity.

Requirements


You are based in Berlin or willing to relocate within four weeks of starting.
You thrive in a dynamic startup environment, where fast development cycles and quick deployment are essential.
You have 4+ years of experience in software engineering, data analysis, or software engineering management.
You meet most of the following criteria:
Strong Python skills: You have at least 3-5 years of hands-on coding experience.
Data Visualization & Data Science: You enjoy making complex data understandable and have a solid background in Data Science or Mathematics, especially in working with geospatial data.
Cloud Expertise: You are familiar with AWS architecture and comfortable working with serverless tools (e.g., AWS Lambda, Athena, S3).
Customer-Focused Mindset: You enjoy working closely with customers, helping them get the most out of the product, and explaining technical concepts in an accessible way.
Allrounder: You are fine with switching between roles. Sometimes you are a project manager, sometimes a Data Scientist, sometimes a Backend engineer or QA engineer.

Your Role at Truemetrics

Data Exploration, Analysis & Improvement


Analyze and prepare data: By preparing data in a way that is easy to understand, you ensure our customers receive meaningful insights.
Customer Success & Onboarding: You help present our product to customers and continuously improve the early onboarding experience.
Support POCs & Pilot Projects: You help manage proof-of-concept (POC) and pilot projects, ensuring smooth execution and learning opportunities.


Software Engineering


Troubleshooting & Data Quality: If something breaks in our data, you investigate the root cause and propose solutions. If everything burns, you are playing the detective to find out what didn‚Äôt went well
Prototyping & Innovation: You design and implement early prototypes for new features and contribute ideas for improving our algorithms and data processing techniques.


How to Apply


Include the role's title in your subject line.
Please include your CV .
Please tell us why you think you would be a good fit for this role, be specific.
Do you have an impressive GitHub repo to prove your skills? Great!
Show more

Title: DevOps/ML Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Machine Learning Reply, we work with our customers on cutting-edge projects for which we are looking for DevOps and ML Engineers to support our customer projects around machine learning and data processing across various industries. To expand our team, we are looking for a talented and highly skilled consultant with a technical background to join our team. As a consultant, you will be responsible for providing expert advice and technical support to our clients.

If you're a DevOps or ML Engineer or just starting out in the field of machine learning and/or DevOps engineering - if you never lose focus, love coding, data and AI, and are passionate about bringing your ideas to life - then we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:


Design innovative, technical approaches for data intensive and applications with a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Implement and take ownership for your solutions on in either cloud based (AWS, Azure or GCP) and/or on-premises infrastructures of our customers.
Automate recurring tasks by state-of-the-art DevOps and MLOps concepts, enabling your customers to significantly reduce their time-to-delivery.
Take care of the necessary‚ÄØmonitoring, failover, and recovery infrastructures‚ÄØthat allow our customers save operation of their machine learning solutions in agreement with latest regulatory requirements
Closely‚ÄØinteract with customers and stakeholders‚ÄØto translate concrete and complex business requirements into production-ready‚ÄØsolutions
Collaborate with various disciplines‚ÄØsuch as enterprise architects, analysts,‚ÄØdata scientists or‚ÄØdata engineers‚ÄØto develop data-intensive applications such as data warehouses, data lakes and/or data platforms



What we offer you:


Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)
Broaden your skills through interdisciplinary work and training in the areas of data engineering, cloud architecture, and data science
Benefit from industry-leading cooperations in the cloud, BI, and AutoML field
Very active social program - including training, conferences, team buildings, Reply Exchange, communities of practices, and hackathons
Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge-sharing network
Award-winning office space in downtown Munich with access to ‚ÄúStammstrecke‚Äù
You choose your state-of-the-art equipment
Public transport ticket with Deutschlandticket
Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice
Flexible work environment between client, Reply office, and remote work



Minimum Job Requirements / Qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs / master‚Äôs degree in computer science or any other related fileds (e.g. engineering, statistics, physics).
First practical experience with DevOps/MLOps principals and computing platforms like Microsoft Azure, AWS and GCP as well as Databricks.
Ability to convincingly communicate and present analytical results to management.
We cover the full lifecycle of Data, from Cloud Infrastructure, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, and Visualization to ML Engineering to and MLOps. Interest and/or experience in some of those fields is an advantage.
Fluent in English and able to speak German at least at a B2 Level.



Desired:


Working experience in cloud technologies (AWS, Azure or GCP), Kubernetes and programming languages like Python, Java and Scala.
Practical experience with SQL and NoSQL database technologies and data lakes
Experience with big data technologies (Apache Spark), data streaming (Apache Kafka) and workflow orchestration (Apache Airflow, Dagster)

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
Data Science Analyst- Revenue Growth Management - Maternity Cover (Until end 2025)




At Costa Coffee, we are what we craft. We‚Äôre reimagining coffee experiences in over 50 countries and counting, as a key part of the Coca-Cola System. Whether you get your coffee in a store, from a machine, at home, or on the go ‚Äì we‚Äôve got you covered.




We are on the lookout for an experienced Data Science Analyst with demonstrable experience of Data Science and Machine Learning to harness the potential of our brand new cutting-edge pricing tool, empowering our Global markets with insightful analysis. We are seeking a unique combination of technical competence using data analysis tools and programming languages with a natural flair for providing data and insight for decision making. You will infuse magic and creativity to support the business in driving forward decisions around pricing and promotions.




Our teams make a difference. Whether that‚Äôs working on new tech for the perfect pour, helping our teams grow, creating award-winning campaigns, crunching the numbers, or developing the latest exciting menu item; together, we stir up success.




We may be a global brand, but we haven‚Äôt forgotten our roots. That‚Äôs where the Costa Foundation and our fantastic community agenda come in. Whatever your role, you can help us change lives in coffee growing communities, and help your local community too.




We also want to help you grow in your career through amazing experiences, our apprenticeship scheme, and development programmes. At Costa, you can go beyond the day-to-day.




And as a Data Science Analyst, there‚Äôs never been a better time to join.




So, why Costa?

We didn‚Äôt become a global coffee brand by sitting back. When you work here, you join a community that values passion, progression and integrity, with some pretty brilliant perks to sweeten the deal:

A smart pension that saves you money on tax and national insurance, and matches your contributions up to 10%
The Costa Financial Support Fund, supporting team members who find themselves in unexpected financial pressure
50% discount in all Costa-owned stores, and 25% off in other participating stores
Private medical cover thanks to our Private Healthcare scheme
And that‚Äôs not all. Explore even more of our perks here: https://bit.ly/costaperks




We‚Äôre passionate about being a great place to work, where you can bring your unique self into our mix. We firmly support diversity, equity and inclusion, and continue to work with our teams to shape the future of our culture and values: Disciplined to Deliver, Passion for Progress, Win with Warmth, Courage to Challenge and Trusted Team Players.




What you‚Äôll do

Being a Data Science Analyst is about so much more than bringing our coffee to the world. It‚Äôs your chance to stir up real success - which means you‚Äôll be:

Responsible for collecting, cleaning, modelling, analyzing and reporting data from various sources, as well as creating data visualizations and dashboards to communicate your findings. Additionally you will be
Performing exploratory and descriptive data analysis to identify patterns, trends, outliers, and anomalies
Applying statistical and machine learning techniques to build predictive and prescriptive models and test hypotheses
Use feature engineering to create new data points that leverage the data to the best of our ability
Communicating data findings and insights to internal and external stakeholders using clear and concise language and storytelling




Who you are

It‚Äôs your unique ingredients we‚Äôre interested in:

Proven experience working in a marketing/ consumer/data science analytics role
Educated to degree standard in a statistics, mathematics, computer science, or engineering or similar discipline or equivalent experience
Strong programming skills in PySpark, SQL, Python, R, or SAS with the ability to write production level code
Experience with Microsoft Azure including Azure Databricks and Azure Data Factory
Experience with most standard python libraries used in Machine Learning (e.g. Sci-Kit Learn, Pandas, Numpy, XGBoost, TensorFlow etc)
Strong understanding of a range of statistical models and machine learning methods including supervised/unsupervised and reinforcement learning.
Skilled in working with large and complex datasets with a keen eye for detail and accuracy
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio
A team player, eager to learn, engage and collaborate with stakeholders
Bags of initiative and drive




Location: Hybrid ‚Äì must be able to work from our Central London location a minimum of 2 days per week.




For any reasonable adjustments and general queries, please get in touch with costa.recruitment@costacoffee.com

  • A smart pension that saves you money on tax and national insurance, and matches your contributions up to 10%
  • The Costa Financial Support Fund, supporting team members who find themselves in unexpected financial pressure
  • 50% discount in all Costa-owned stores, and 25% off in other participating stores
  • Private medical cover thanks to our Private Healthcare scheme
  • And that‚Äôs not all. Explore even more of our perks here: https://bit.ly/costaperks


We‚Äôre passionate about being a great place to work, where you can bring your unique self into our mix. We firmly support diversity, equity and inclusion, and continue to work with our teams to shape the future of our culture and values: Disciplined to Deliver, Passion for Progress, Win with Warmth, Courage to Challenge and Trusted Team Players.


What you‚Äôll do

Being a Data Science Analyst is about so much more than bringing our coffee to the world. It‚Äôs your chance to stir up real success - which means you‚Äôll be:

  • Responsible for collecting, cleaning, modelling, analyzing and reporting data from various sources, as well as creating data visualizations and dashboards to communicate your findings. Additionally you will be
  • Performing exploratory and descriptive data analysis to identify patterns, trends, outliers, and anomalies
  • Applying statistical and machine learning techniques to build predictive and prescriptive models and test hypotheses
  • Use feature engineering to create new data points that leverage the data to the best of our ability
  • Communicating data findings and insights to internal and external stakeholders using clear and concise language and storytelling


Who you are

It‚Äôs your unique ingredients we‚Äôre interested in:

  • Proven experience working in a marketing/ consumer/data science analytics role
  • Educated to degree standard in a statistics, mathematics, computer science, or engineering or similar discipline or equivalent experience
  • Strong programming skills in PySpark, SQL, Python, R, or SAS with the ability to write production level code
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure including Azure Databricks and Azure Data Factory
  • Experience with most standard python libraries used in Machine Learning (e.g. Sci-Kit Learn, Pandas, Numpy, XGBoost, TensorFlow etc)
  • Strong understanding of a range of statistical models and machine learning methods including supervised/unsupervised and reinforcement learning.
  • Skilled in working with large and complex datasets with a keen eye for detail and accuracy
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio
  • A team player, eager to learn, engage and collaborate with stakeholders
  • Bags of initiative and drive


Location: Hybrid ‚Äì must be able to work from our Central London location a minimum of 2 days per week.


For any reasonable adjustments and general queries, please get in touch with costa.recruitment@costacoffee.com

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
Founding Machine Learning Scientist ‚Äì Frontier AI/Deep Tech




Are you ready to disrupt technology at scale? Join our YC-backed, AI-native startup as we embark on an exhilarating journey to revolutionize deep tech with next-generation, frontier-level AI products. As a founding team member, you'll drive innovation and transform the landscape of advanced technology across industries.




Your Impact

Trailblaze Innovation: Design and implement breakthrough AI models and algorithms that underpin our cutting-edge deep tech solutions.
Shape the Future: Collaborate with an elite, interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists to tackle the most challenging problems in technology.
Lead and Inspire: Spearhead strategic research initiatives, mentor your peers, and help define the visionary roadmap that fuels our rapid expansion.




What You‚Äôll Do

Innovate in AI: Leverage your expertise to craft novel architectures and training strategies that push the boundaries of what's possible in deep tech.
Experiment and Iterate: Conduct rigorous experiments, refine models, and translate complex data into actionable insights that drive innovation.
Collaborate and Scale: Partner with experts across diverse fields to build scalable, high-impact solutions that redefine technology as we know it.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

Essential Qualifications:

Advanced degree (PhD preferred, or Masters/equivalent practical experience) in a technical field.
A proven track record in deep learning and machine learning research - from conceptualization and design to hands-on implementation.
Proficiency in ML frameworks (JAX, PyTorch, TensorFlow) and scientific libraries (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas).
A passion for leveraging cutting-edge AI to solve real-world challenges and push technological frontiers.




Bonus Points:

Experience with large-scale deep learning, generative models, graph neural networks, or applied reinforcement learning.
A history of impactful research, notable publications, or significant contributions to open-source AI projects.
Background in a multidisciplinary scientific environment, driving innovation across various domains.




Our Culture




We thrive on radical autonomy and creative freedom. Here, innovation isn‚Äôt just encouraged - it‚Äôs expected. If you're driven to build game-changing technology and want to leave a lasting mark on the future of deep tech, this is your platform.




Ready to make history? Join us on this ground-breaking journey to redefine the possibilities of AI and technology at scale. Your adventure in deep tech starts here.

Title: Data Scientist ‚Äì Consumer Behaviour
Description:
Data Scientist ‚Äì Consumer Behaviour




London office hybrid 3 days per week - Salary negotiable dep on experience between ¬£70,000-¬£80,000 - J12933




Please note this client is unable to offer sponsorship so please ensure you have full UK working rights.




Datatech are working exclusively with a boutique start up in London, staffed across the UK, US and Canada, to grow their team. This leading consumer behavioural data organisation are servicing some of the largest brands and media companies worldwide and have been working for the last 6 + years adding value to their clients.




This company have an incredible amount of data, and having just skimmed the surface of this, there is a huge opportunity to delve deeper and bring their potential to life.




For the role of Data Scientist, we are looking for an enthusiastic and driven individual, ready to get stuck into some extremely interesting projects and work with some huge global brands.




In this role, you will be responsible for modelling, applying econometric techniques such as regression analysis and using technologies such as SQL and Python.




You‚Äôll be working in an incredibly supportive and social team, where each employee is an individual contributor and has a voice to produce ideas and ways of success.




The Role

Gather, refine, and pre-process large-scale media datasets from diverse sources (CRM, ad servers, audience panels) to ensure accuracy and readiness for analysis.
Apply econometric techniques such as regression analysis, time series modelling, and panel data analysis to uncover insights into the impact of media spend on business outcomes.
Deliver data-driven insights to optimize media buying strategies, guiding channel allocation, budget distribution, and creative testing for maximum impact.
Advanced analytics- explore advanced data analysis techniques, such as machine learning, to improve model accuracy and uncover deeper, more actionable insights.




The Ideal Candidate

5+ years of experience with a strong proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques (e.g., SQL, Python).
Knowledge of different media channels (social media, print, television, online advertising) and their metrics.
Previous Econometrics background, expertise in statical methods like linear regression
Data modelling knowledge.
Understanding business objectives and ability to translate data insights into actionable actions.







If this sounds like the role for you then please apply today!




Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. For each relevant candidate that you introduce to us (there is no limit) and we place, you will be entitled to our general gift/voucher scheme.




Datatech is one of the UK‚Äôs leading recruitment agencies in the field of analytics and host of the critically acclaimed event, Women in Data. For more information, visit our website: www.datatech.org.uk

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Heart Mind Talent is proud to partner with a fast-growing, mission-driven startup that is building the future of the energy grid. Their goal is to optimize renewable energy usage, reduce CO‚ÇÇ emissions, and make electricity greener and more affordable for everyone.

As the energy system evolves at an unprecedented pace, innovative software solutions are critical in the fight for a net-zero future.




This company‚Äôs cutting-edge platform leverages machine learning to shift energy consumption to times when electricity is cheapest and cleanest.




Backed by leading investors, they are scaling rapidly to meet this global challenge.




Why Join?

At the intersection of advanced software and real-world energy systems, this company is moving gigawatt-hours of electricity while maintaining the agility of a startup.

With ambitious goals and a world-class team, they are pioneering a new era of smart energy systems.




As a Data Scientist, you will:

Take full ownership of projects, driving them from concept to deployment.
Solve complex problems in renewable energy optimization and data science.
Develop machine learning models that drive both commercial success and environmental transformation.




We are seeking innovative Data Scientists who:

Have 4+ years of experience as a Data Scientist in a startup environment.
Have a strong background in data science and machine learning, particularly with time-series data.
Have the courage to build and iterate quickly.
Prioritize impact over perfection, focusing on real-world applications.
Thrive in collaborative, fast-moving teams where every contribution matters.
Are passionate about fighting climate change and shaping the future of energy.




Bonus Points If You Have:

Knowledge of electricity systems, particularly power trading.
Experience engaging with clients and managing stakeholder relationships.
Expertise in time-series forecasting models and working with energy data.




Benefits & Culture

Hybrid Work Model ‚Äì Team members are encouraged to spend two to three days per week in the London office to foster collaboration and learning.
Inclusive & Mission-Driven ‚Äì The company is committed to building a diverse, inclusive team and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds, even if they do not meet every listed qualification.
Real-World Impact ‚Äì Your work will contribute directly to decarbonizing the grid and driving the clean energy transition.

Title: Data Scientist - Regulatory Scanning Initiative
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to spearhead the data science efforts within our Regulatory Scanning Initiative. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data science, machine learning, and predictive analytics, with a proven ability to lead projects and teams. This role involves developing and implementing advanced data processing and analysis techniques to enhance our regulatory scanning capabilities, increase operational efficiency, and expand our coverage to multiple industries and jurisdictions.




Key Responsibilities




Leadership and Strategy:

Providing strategic direction and technical guidance for data science initiatives
Collaborate with the Head of Regulatory Scanning to define and execute data science strategies that align with business objectives.
Mentor and develop analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.




Data Processing and Modeling:

Design and implement data pipelines for ingesting and processing large volumes of regulatory data from diverse sources.
Develop machine learning models and algorithms for data categorization, contextualization, and predictive analytics.
Ensure the accuracy, quality, and relevance of data insights provided to internal stakeholders and customers.




Predictive Analytics and Trend Analysis:

Leverage predictive analytics to identify emerging regulatory trends and potential future changes.
Create models to forecast the impact of regulatory changes on different industries and jurisdictions.
Develop and refine methods for prioritizing regulatory updates based on customer relevance.




Collaboration and Integration:

Work closely with product managers, developers, and regulatory analysts to integrate data science solutions into Vixio‚Äôs technology stack.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure data-driven decision-making and alignment with overall business goals.
Communicate complex data insights in a clear and actionable manner to non-technical stakeholders.




Innovation and Continuous Improvement:

Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
Identify and implement new tools, techniques, and technologies to enhance data processing and analysis capabilities.
Continuously improve data science workflows and methodologies to increase efficiency and effectiveness.




Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. A Ph.D. is a plus.




Experience:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist, with a track record of successfully leading data science projects.
Strong expertise in machine learning, statistical modeling, and predictive analytics.
Experience in RegTech, FinTech, or related industries is highly desirable.
Demonstrated experience in managing and mentoring teams.




Technical Skills:

Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, Scikit-learn).
Strong knowledge of SQL and database management.
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).




Soft Skills:

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with natural language processing (NLP) and text analytics.
Knowledge of regulatory frameworks and compliance requirements.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company: AKT II

Division: Software Development Team

Role: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: London (Hybrid)

Status: Permanent

Start Date - ASAP




AKT II has successfully delivered several machine learning projects in recent years, and we are now expanding our ML capabilities across core business operations and external services. As part of this growth, we are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our Software Development Team in London.




Our Software Development Team‚Äîa dynamic group of software developers and AEC specialists‚Äîbuilds bespoke digital tools to support AKT II‚Äôs diverse expertise, including structural engineering, fa√ßade design, bioclimatic analysis, zero-carbon solutions, and geotechnical design. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge ML-driven solutions that enhance our engineering and design workflows.




As a Machine Learning Engineer your responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:




Designing and implementing ML pipelines to solve complex engineering problems in the AEC industry.
Creating commercial and scalable ML solutions, for production environments.
Interfacing directly with AEC subject matter experts to co-develop project specifications.
Tracking emerging trends in ML development, and communicating their potential applications to the practice.
Educating Software Development team members on effective ML techniques, software, and services.
Creating documentation and training materials for ML systems.




Qualifications And Experience:




Master‚Äôs degree (with 2+ years of industry experience) or Bachelor‚Äôs degree (with 3+ years of industry experience) in Computer Science, or related field with ML focus.
Experience with ML techniques for 3D spatial data analysis.
Experience with orchestrating enterprise-grade cloud-based ML services.




Skills:




Contributions to open-source ML projects.
Understanding of software development best practices (version control, CI/CD, testing).
Familiarity with containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes).
Experience in the AEC industry, or with engineering applications (desirable)




What's in it for you?




The chance to work for an innovative, design-led studio based in London with the opportunity to work on some of the very best projects across the UK and internationally, plus a friendly, dedicated team and a competitive salary. You‚Äôll receive AKT II‚Äôs many employee benefits including a vibrant social calendar, with many company-funded events and activities.




Benefits:




Annual leave entitlement of 25 days per annum + public holidays.
Holiday trading scheme.
Enhanced company pension contribution.
Flexible & hybrid working.
Gym membership + Class Pass.
Restaurant discount card.
Healthcare scheme and health screening.
Dental insurance.
Access to wellbeing support services via our Employee Assistance Programme.
Fun company events including our annual winter party and our full company summer social.
Retail discounts.
Season ticket loans.
Cycle to work scheme.
Monthly breakfasts.
Sports clubs.




All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. AKT II is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all communities.

$20bn Discretionary Hedge Fund

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Role: Junior Data Scientist

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: ¬£35k-¬£45k (DOE)




Are you passionate about data and finance? Join a revolutionary financial services company in the heart of London, where you'll help over 200,000 businesses across the UK and Europe navigate challenges and boost profitability.




My client is looking for a Junior Data Scientist eager to apply their analytical and modeling skills to provide insight and drive impactful business decisions.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyse complex datasets: Work with large volumes of financial data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decisions.
Support predictive modeling: Collaborate on the development of machine learning models to forecast financial outcomes and optimise business processes.
Develop data-driven solutions: Create algorithms and tools that automate and enhance decision-making across the company.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with finance, product, and technology teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Visualise data insights: Build and maintain interactive dashboards and visualisations that provide clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM field: Preferred disciplines include Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Proficiency in programming languages: Experience with Python and SQL for data analysis, manipulation, and modeling.
Basic understanding of machine learning: Familiarity with predictive modeling techniques and algorithms, in particular NLP, LLM's and Time Series Forecasting.
Experience with data visualization tools: Knowledge of tools like Tableau/Power BI, or similar to present data effectively.
Strong analytical skills: Ability to interpret complex data and communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience in finance: Prior exposure to financial data or working in a financial services environment is a plus.
Curiosity and drive: A passion for learning and staying updated with the latest trends in data science and finance.
Problem-solving mindset: Ability to think critically and approach challenges with innovative solutions.




The Benefits:

Growth opportunities: Be part of a fast-growing company with ample opportunities for career advancement.
Innovative work environment: Work with a team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning.
Cutting-edge tools and technologies: Access to the latest data science tools to help you excel in your role.
Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your skills and experience, along with performance-based bonuses.




If you‚Äôre a motivated Junior Data Scientist with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making, we want to hear from you. Apply now to join our team and be part of shaping the future of the finance industry.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Recommendation Systems and Experimentation




12-month FTC - ¬£106,000 - ¬£125,000 - London




We are looking for a senior data scientist to join a cross-functional recommendations team within a leading technology company. This role focuses on large-scale experimentation, hypothesis testing, and recommendation systems, helping to shape the future of personalised experiences across a widely used platform.




Key responsibilities:

Design and conduct large-scale A/B tests and hypothesis-driven experiments to assess the impact of product feature changes
Work closely with machine learning scientists, engineers, and product teams to optimise recommendation models
Develop statistical frameworks to evaluate algorithmic improvements and marketplace dynamics
Translate complex data problems into actionable insights that influence product strategy
Partner with stakeholders to define key metrics and measure the impact of recommendations on user behaviour, engagement, retention, and revenue




What we are looking for:

Experience working with recommendation engines within a data science capacity
Strong background in hypothesis testing, A/B testing, and large-scale experimentation
Proficiency in Python (pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, statsmodels) and SQL for data analysis
Solid understanding of statistical modelling, inference, and regression analysis
Ability to quantify the impact of product feature changes beyond traditional marketing experiments
Experience working in multi-sided marketplaces, online platforms, or digital consumer products is a plus




This is an excellent opportunity for a data scientist who enjoys working in a fast-paced, experimentation-driven environment, applying advanced statistical techniques to drive product innovation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Cure Talent is excited to partner with TympaHealth, a rapidly growing medical technology company that is transforming hearing healthcare. We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer / AI Engineer to join their talented team, working on cutting-edge machine learning models for image and audio analysis.




The successful Machine Learning Engineer / AI Engineer will play a crucial role in developing, deploying, and optimising AI-driven insights to enhance business processes and support data-driven decision-making. This is a hands-on position where you'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to integrate machine learning models into real-world applications.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop AI models for classification, segmentation, and processing of image and audio data.
Optimise machine learning models to ensure peak performance.
Work closely with software development teams to integrate AI models into applications.
Collect, clean, and manipulate data from multiple sources (SQL, Excel, Salesforce, etc.).
Contribute to the development and maintenance of the company‚Äôs Data Lakehouse and centralised data store.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in AI, machine learning, and data engineering.




We‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Engineer / AI Engineer with:




Strong proficiency in deploying cloud-based machine learning pipelines, particularly on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Vertex AI.
Extensive experience in Python programming and using Jupyter notebooks.
Deep expertise in deep learning frameworks such as Keras, PyTorch, and CoreML.
Strong knowledge of image processing techniques and algorithms.
Experience in data wrangling, processing, and technical documentation.
The ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




If you‚Äôre a Machine Learning Engineer / AI Engineer ready to work on innovative AI-driven solutions in a fast-paced MedTech environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Graduate Software Developer
Description:
Job Title: Graduate Software Developer

Location: Redhill

Salary: ¬£28k plus bonus

Sector: IT

A leading independent provider of satellite communications and IT management solution, our client provides best-in-class satellite solutions to marine, offshore and land-based users. With offices in the UK, Europe, Asia and the USA, they have extensive experience of working with some of the largest commercial maritime operators such as Teekay, NYK and MOL.

With over 50 years of experience in the government and maritime mobility markets, the business employs over 200+ with over 40% of its company consisting of highly specialised engineers, many of who are ex-armed forces. This must be why they are trusted by major NATO government members including the UK Armed Forces, Germany's Bundeswehr and The Danish Defence Force!

The company is now searching for dynamic, results-driven graduates to join their team and ensure they remain a fast growing and innovative organisation.

Package/ Benefits:

¬£28k basic salary
An annual bonus subject to personal & business performance
Excellent progression, learning and development potential - you will continually be offered fantastic training, an excellent opportunity to earn whilst you learn!
Full tech stack provided
Regular socials in a welcoming, inclusive environment
Lucrative bonus and incentive schemes - you will be recognised and rewarded for your success
Fantastic offices in a prime location, with opportunity to travel!

Role:

Bespoke Product/software developments
Help to maintain existing applications and developments
Maintain standard code versioning for developments
Create and Maintain Design and Development Documentation
Create and present User Guides and online Help Documentation
Maintain bug/patch register
To monitor and configure system configurations using agreed documentation and change control procedures.
Manage user access and security, review licenses and track usage
Develop & enhance as required existing corporate applications.
Complete Daily/Weekly maintenance tasks and improve tasks where possible
Analyse system performance indicators and develop/implement/recommend improvement actions where applicable.

Requirements:

A strong IT software programming qualification or background
Microsoft .net and Sql experience would be advantageous
Strong numeric and analytical skills
A keen and enthusiastic individual, keen to learn more and expand their knowledge into relevant technologies that will enhance our in-house systems and our offerings to customers
Able to communicate effectively via verbal and written means with technical and non-technical users.
Self-motivated and has initiative to follow-up on issues and can work unsupervised
Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle

Pareto is committed to promoting equality, diversity and inclusion. We encourage and welcome applications from all, irrespective of background or circumstance. Our consultants are happy to discuss any adjustments you require in support of your application.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Software Engineer
Description:
Designation: Artificial Intelligence Software Engineer




Experience Level: 3-7 Years in AI & ML




Responsibilities




Your primary responsibility will be researching, conceptualizing, and creating learning material and educational content related to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.
Conduct LIVE Training sessions for AI & ML space.
Brainstorm and help evaluate applications for new tools and technologies as they continually evolve.
Be involved proactively in the global communities supported by the company
Guide new team members in up-skilling




Skills




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in AI & ML.
Proficiency in Generative AI tools like ChatGPT, Gemini etc
Deep understanding of machine learning algorithms and natural language processing.
Software development background and exposure of open-source projects
Proficiency in one of the programming languages used in AIML, such as Python, R, or Julia.
Knowledge of AI & ML ethics and responsible AI practices.
Familiarity with AI & ML platforms - PyTorch, TensorFlow, AWS Sagemaker, Google Cloud AI Platform, Scikit- learn, etc.
Contribution in any AIML Research projects or any initiative.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills in the English Language.

Benefits




Attractive salaries
Semi-flexible schedule
Medical Insurance & Accidental Insurance
5 days a week work
